body_html: I can remove the iter and range if we think it's not necessary (I'm not sure that it is because I don't think users are using this). It is there because currently the torch.Size() constructor handles iter and range but changing torch.Size() to use the python arg parser results in it not being able to handle iter/range.
body_text: I can remove the iter and range if we think it's not necessary (I'm not sure that it is because I don't think users are using this). It is there because currently the torch.Size() constructor handles iter and range but changing torch.Size() to use the python arg parser results in it not being able to handle iter/range.
body: I can remove the iter and range if we think it's not necessary (I'm not sure that it is because I don't think users are using this). It is there because currently the `torch.Size()` constructor handles iter and range but changing `torch.Size()` to use the python arg parser results in it not being able to handle iter/range.
